# Introduction {-}

> Laplacian renomalisation group (LRG) is a dimensional reduction technique inspired from physics. 
> The specific heat of a physical system, ie network, can be used to measure the point at which
> the system transitions from high-dimensional space to a coarse-dimensional space whilst 
> preserving the underlying toplogy of the system.
>
> [1] Villegas, P., Gili, T., Caldarelli, G. et al. Laplacian renormalization group for heterogeneous networks. Nat. Phys. 19, 445â€“450 (2023). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41567-022-01866-8
>

<br>
<br>

```{r}

```

```{r}

bw  = 2

df1 = bin.eigen(ba1, group="A")
df2 = bin.eigen(ba2, group="B")
df3 = bin.eigen(ba3, group="C")

df1 = smooth.bin.eigen(df1, bandwidth=bw)
df2 = smooth.bin.eigen(df2, bandwidth=bw)
df3 = smooth.bin.eigen(df3, bandwidth=bw)

df  = rbind(df1,df2,df3)

pt1 = ggplot(df, aes(x,y,group=group))+
  geom_line(aes(color=group), linewidth=1)+
  scale_color_manual(
    name="", 
    values=c(A="red", B="green", C="blue"),
    labels=c(A="m=1", B="m=2", C="m=3"))+
   scale_x_log10(
      name = TeX("$\\lambda$"),
      breaks = scales::trans_breaks("log10", function(x) 10^x),
      labels = scales::trans_format("log10", scales::math_format(10^.x)))+
    scale_y_log10(
      name = TeX("P($\\lambda$)"),
      breaks = scales::trans_breaks("log10", function(x) 10^x),
```

>
> BA scale-free network with 1000 vertices
>

>
> Set the random seed for reproducibility
>


```{r}

## Number of samples
Nits = 1 #500

## Node of nodes
Nv = 1000

## m = [1,2,3]
## default m = 1
m = 1

p=1

## Node names
gn = seq(1,Nv,1)

Lmean      = matrix(0,Nv,Nv)
Esample    = list()
Vsample    = matrix(0,Nv,Nv)
Vinvsample = matrix(0,Nv,Nv)

for( i in 1:Nits ){

## Barabasi Graph
gg=sample_pa(n=Nv, m=m, p=p, directed=FALSE)

## Set node names
V(gg)$name = gn

L = get.L(gg)
E = get.eigen(L, only.values=FALSE, inv.vec=TRUE)

Lmean        = Lmean + as.matrix(L)
Esample[[i]] = E[[1]]
Vsample      = Vsample + E[[2]]
Vinvsample   = Vsample + E[[3]]

}

Lmean   = Lmean/Nits  
Emargin = do.call(rbind, Esample)
Emean   = apply(Emargin, 2, mean)
Esd     = apply(Emargin, 2, sd)
Evec    = Vsample/Nits
Evinv   = Vinvsample/Nits

```

> Plots
>


```{r}

# Create the first tibble with time intervals from 10^-4 to 10^4 with step 0.1
df1 <- tibble(tau = seq(10^-4, 10^4, by = 0.1))

# Create the second tibble with time intervals from 10^-4 to 1 with step 10^-2
df2 <- tibble(tau = seq(10^-4, 1, by = 10^-2))

# Combine the two tibbles
df  <- bind_rows(df1, df2)

# Remove duplicates and reorder the rows by tau in ascending order
df  <- df %>% 
       distinct() %>%  # Remove duplicates
       arrange(tau)    # Reorder by tau (ascending)
```

> Where does dC/dt cross zero

```{r}
tt.steps = 1e-2
tt      = tibble(tau=seq(1e-4,1e2, tt.steps))
dc      = dC_dt_test_wrapper(n=Nv, t=tt$tau, e=Emean)
dc.diff = diff(sign(dc))
dc.indx = which(abs(dc.diff)==2)
tau.x   = NA
if( length(dc.indx) > 0 ){ tau.x   = tt$tau[dc.indx] }
```

```{r}
print(tau.x)
```

> Calculate graph renormalisation round tau.x

```{r}

##test
t.upper = 5 #tps$tp$tp.x_axis[4] #0.090
t.lower = 0.01 #tps$tp$tp.x_axis[1] #0.060

lrg.scan = scan.time(gg=gg, e=E[[1]], v=E[[2]], vinv=E[[3]], L=L, t.lower=t.lower, t.upper=t.upper,
                      complex=FALSE, method="eigen", order=1, n.steps=150, print=0)

```

```{r}

t.upper = 2 #tps$tp$tp.x_axis[4] #0.090
t.lower = 0.01 #tps$tp$tp.x_axis[1] #0.060


## TEST
lrg.ann = anneal.time(gg=gg, L=L, e=E[[1]], v=E[[2]], vinv=E[[3]], 
                      t.lower=t.lower, t.upper=t.upper, cooling_rate=0.85,
                      complex=FALSE, method="eigen", max_iter=100, dt=1, print=0)
```


> Best LRG time based on cross-entropy loss:


```{r}
metric="jsd"
x = lrg.scan$df$t
y = lrg.scan$df[,metric]
df.scan = data.frame(x=x, y=y)

pt5 <- ggplot(df.scan, aes(x,y)) +
  geom_line() + 
  ggtitle("Jensson-Shannon Distance between ecdf of network, \n and cdf of fitted lrg network")+
  labs(x="time", y="JSD")+
  geom_point(data=lrg.ann$df, aes(x=new_t,y=Loss.new), color="red")+
  geom_line(data=lrg.ann$df, aes(x=new_t,y=Loss.new), color="red")+
  theme_light() 

```

```{r}

## Scan algorithm
indx.best = which.min(lrg.scan$df$jsd)
```
